name: Alla Nikitina
text: Out of business

resp.text: Actually, we are not out of business.  We have a new location that we are working on opening up after the Hurricane Sally destruction to our old building but we have been working from remote locations since Sally.  Our website, Facebook page, Pinterest, Google My Business page, etc. all reflect we are open for business and have been open for business.  Our phone number is active as well so feel free to contact us if you have a project you are interested in us quoting for you.  251-943-5358.

name: ted croft
text: They dont stand behind their products! Bought a marble vanity top and they installed two sinks (undermount) and the silicone bled through to the surface of the top and stained it where the silicone was applied for the sinks. The top is ruined! After sending pics Mike told me to call the manufacturer of the silicone to get it fixed or remedied. What terrible customer service. Good thing he sold the company!

resp.text: Ted is correct, the business has been sold to the owner of Folkers Window Company.  The marble vanity top Ted purchased was a old remnant from the warehouse and was "sold as is" for a very cheap price.  Unfortunately with remnants and very low prices, these things happen.  This was communicated to the customer at the time of the sale.  The best way to avoid issues with products and expired warranties is to purchase new products instead of remnants.

name: Anisha Penton
text: Amazing company to work with! Very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful staff.

resp.text: Great choice with Silestone quartz counter tops

name: Gayle Patterson
text: Jill Kinard is very knowledgeable and helpful.

resp.text: Thanks much.  Hopefully we can assist with your remodeling project

name: Cheryl McCoy
text: Good products, pricey

resp.text: Thanks for the business and the review.  No, we are not the cheapest because as you said "good products".  We do not sell junk and we use professional installers and not sub contractors.  In addition, we use stainless steel fasteners, high grade caulks, etc. all which lead to a higher price and a higher quality installation.  Thus, we will typically not be the cheapest...but we're the best.

name: Curtis Motes
text: Good hard-working crew

name: Keith Cooper
text: They get the job done and an honest man can still get a contractor I think that's pretty good thing

name: Leslie W
text: It was a pleasure to work with Pickett Construction. I have a small loft that needed a new kitchen. Josh and his team came up with several different ideas on how to best maximize the space, while still giving me the features that were most important to me. They were very flexible and responsive to me and to the changes I wanted made along the way. Josh stayed in touch throughout the job and all was completed on time. I appreciated the fact that I felt like a true partner in this project. My kitchen is beautiful and it's clear that they paid close attention to every detail. I would highly recommend working with Pickett Construction, not only for the creativity and quality of work, but for the high level of customer service provided every step of the way. I love my new kitchen and so does everyone else who sees it!

name: Robert Allen Clark
text: When did I the 85%owner Robert Allen Clark there ....

resp.text: We don't have anyone by your name in our records. We are Pickett Construction in Alabaster, Alabama. I think you might have meant this review and rating for a different company. If this was meant for us, please give us a call to explain further. (205)620-1798. Thank you

name: Mike Weathers
text: You want find a more committed boss that will make the job rite no matter what it takes

name: Jessica Mccain
text: We used Pickett Construction to remodel our bathroom and kitchen. Pricilla, our salesperson and designer, did a great job helping us get exactly what we wanted. The workers were pleasant, no problems having them in our home. They always left things clean, telling us what time they would return in the morning. We would absolutely recommend Pickett Construction for anything you need to have done in your home. And we will call them again for any future renovations.

name: Wendell Rotenberry
text: We've used Pickett Construction for 3 different projects. They keep prompt appointments and maintain great communication throughout the project. Workers are great craftsmen and friendly. We will use them again for our future projects. The best contractor is Shelby County!

name: Chuck Tanner
text: This is the poorest excuse for a general contractor I have ever seen.  They do not have the skills nor the staff to perform any construction project up to any acceptable level of standards.   I have been around these construction trades for 50 years and they are not managed nor staffed.  If you opt to do business with them make sure you have an attorney draft a contract and require them to post a surety bond for the value of the project for your protection.  I really am surprised based on his past reviews they have slid this far down in skills and service.  Pickett Construction also breached his contract by his poor workmanship.  They attempted to install two metal roofs and both failed building inspection.  This breach resulted in thousands in damages and job delays.

resp.text: Mr. Tanner did sign a contract with Pickett Construction. We were happy to do the work. However, he broke the terms of the agreement. He refused to let us complete the last part of the project and still owes the company thousands of dollars.

name: Andrea Fordham
text: Scott from Pickett Construction was awesome!!!  Him and his crew added a beautiful cover to our patio.  Scott always kept me informed on progress.  The project looks beautiful and now we have an awesome patio to enjoy this summer.  The price was great too!!!  Very reasonable.  Andrea Fordham

name: Meredith R.
text:
You do not give me enough stars.  How about 6 or 7 of them?  I have been through roof installation and repairs to that installation for several years and thousands of dollars.
Pickett Construction LLC was recommended to me by a home inspector (I am a real estate agent).   I ordered a brand new metal roof.  They have covered me up with service.    They do what they say they will do WHEN they say they will do it!  Such competent installers.  Each one is an expert.  The company stands behind its work and it is all guaranteed.  Take this from me:  Do it right the first time.  Use Pickett Construction and look no further.

name: Jammie Eldridge
text: This business is a great one especially making ur home look beautiful & it has homes u can buy or rent. The owner is a really good person he also makes sure it's exactly the way u want it

name: Michael Daniel
text:
8 years ago we hired Pickett Construction to install a new roof, gutters and downspouts, and vinyl siding on our home. The quality of workmanship was outstanding, and the work was completed in  only 5 days. My wife and I could not have been happier.

Then last month after a rain shower, we noticed water stains on the ceiling in two different rooms. Because Pickett installed the roof 8 years ago, we called them about the problem. Josh sent his roofer to our home to see if a cause for the water leak(s) could be found, because from the outside the roofing shingles were not damaged or missing and looked fine. However after a few minutes looking in the attic and walking the roof, it was determined that during construction of my home some 25 years ago, a handful of framing nails used to secure the plywood roof deck had missed the rafter below, and after all these years had begun to back out of the plywood deck, pushing up the roof shingle just enough to let water pass underneath. The roofer walked the entire roof looking for nails that were backing out (not just in the area of the water stains below, but the whole roof), removing all that he found, sealing the hole and making sure the roof shingle lay flat. Two days after the repairs we had a lot of rain, and no water leaks inside the house.

Once again, Pickett Construction has made my wife and I very happy, and I will not hesitate to call them in the future. It's nice to know that the quality of workmanship and professionalism we knew 8 years ago is still present today.

name: tb harvey
text: Hired these people to do light repairs and painting.  Took 3 weeks to complete the painting.  They did poor preparation work on several parts of the house.  They did not paint the rear door to my detached garage,though they painted the trim.  They bent the gutter on my garage and was balking at replacing it until I showed some video.  They did not remount one of my porch lights, nor did they reattach a lens to one of the driveway flood lights. They left trash in the yard and on the front porch and in the plants behind the house. They missed painting trim on one of the back doors.  They replaced a French door that was alarmed. They had to detach the alarm panel from the wall because the new door trim was slightly larger.  After they finished the alarm would not work nor did they remount the alarm panel...just left it hanging by the wires.  When I questioned them the reply was “we don’t do that kind of work.”  Overall the work was substandard and the post work cleanup nearly nonexistent. Cannot recommend these folks . I have pictures if you need to see.

resp.text: We are sorry you had a bad experience.  We don't ask for final balance until you are completely satisfied. Thanks for your input.

name: Linda Ackley
text: Over the years Pickett Construction has re-roofed our home, installed new windows, and re-modeled our bathroom vanity, and kitchen.  We were pleased with all the results.  That is not to say that everything always went smoothly or on time, but that seems to be the norm for the construction business in general.  However, as promised by the Better Business Bureau of which Pickett is a member, they will resolve any problems to the customer's satisfaction and did.  Pickett also re-roofed our daughter's house to her satisfaction.

name: Amelia Cothran
text: I hired Pickett Construction to replace all of the floors in my house. The workers did an excellent job. Everyone was prompt and professional, from Josh in the office to the guys who installed the tile.I appreciated the courtesy with which the workers treated me and my children. I would definitely use Pickett Construction again.

name: Peaches H
text:
Pickett Construction replaced my roof and gutters a few years ago. They did such a good job that I called them when I was ready to replace the siding on my house. It turned out beautifully!
Alas, it had barely been done 4 months when another company dropped a ladder against it hard enough to seriously damage it. That company denied culpability. Nice,huh? I contacted Josh Pickett and he made a few calls and found that they had some siding in my style and color already in stock so I wouldn't have to shell out $300 for another box of siding. He then called his installers to see how much they would charge to swap out the few pieces of damaged siding. Mind you, this is four days before Christmas. Then I got an email saying it had all been fixed and when I asked how much my final bill was I was told "no charge"! Now that is the kind of company I will keep calling when I need repairs done. They bend over backwards to make sure they do the job right and that their customers are happy long term. I am looking forward to my next home improvement project with Pickett Construction.

name: Derek Smith
text: Very Reputable, considerate and helpful.  Quality workmanship.  My roof was done in really cold weather and they finished it in record time but they took care of all the problems that was damaged by hail damage.  I would highly recommend this Construction firm for all your Restoration or building needs.  Top Notched.

name: Tami Pickett
text: Professional services for home remodel or new custom built homes.  Customer service is always on point... Licensed, insured and bonded!  They will work with you to make your vision become a reality!

name: Bud Pommer
text:
I've had three experiences with Pickett Construction. All of them great. First; in the process of selling my home an inspection revealed hail damage on the roof and the determination that the tiles had to be replaced. Called Pickett. They gave an estimate (which ended up being lower than insurance company was going to pay). I signed contract and they showed up when they said they would, completed the work when they said they would, job looked great, did a good job cleaning up and all this done in a respectful and empathetic fashion to meet my need of completion of job prior to closing date on house.
I've moved to the Gulf Coast but still have rental property in Jefferson County.  Insurance company review dictated the need of handrails for front steps. I had one month to get then installed or they would drop my coverage on the house. The Rental Management Company for that property got some quotes but I called Pickett Construction on my own. I gave them the contract knowing I would get quality work done on time. What I really gave them besides the contract was my trust. That's something that's hard to do these days. Again, they didn't let me down!
My third experience with them was to get a quote on electrical work at that rental property. They looked at the job, told me what needed to be done but couldn't do it do it because they were covered up at the time. So, they referred me to an electrician who was half the price of other quotes and also did a great job.
I highly recommend Pickett Construction.

name: Roberts 2839
text: I had a water leak upstairs that ruined the ceiling in my living room. They repaired it quickly and professionally. Great service and friendly workers.

name: Greg Clyburn
text: I had the outside of my home repaired/updated by Pickett in 2013.  Ricky came out to give me a bid on the work and suggested some items that I had not considered.  Ricky took into account not only the house but the grounds, including sidewalk and driveway.  I agreed to these suggestions and could not be happier with the work.  I now come home (2014) to an updated home (outside) each day thanks to Ricky's suggestions.  The work was done in a timely, professional manner.  I will contact Pickett for my next home repair/update need.

name: Callie Dan
text: This contractor is outstanding! Dependable, on time, quality caftsmamship, accessible, on budget... I would recommend them to anyone.. Hope they never move away from alabaster!

name: David Roberts
text: I have used them for two jobs around my house.  They started work at the scheduled time and made sure that I was satisfied with the work done.

name: Brian Pavlick
text: Our house had some water damage leak down the walls and cause damage to the interior/exterior walls and damaged the hardwood floors as well.  Ricky came first and within 10 minutes had not only an initial diagnosis but a wonderful recommendation as far as procedure to take care of the job.  Since our first call with Pickett, we were completely satisfied.  Nevermind that they did a wonderful job and that they completed their work in the timeframe they said, I was more impressed with the individuals who respected our home and my wife staying at home by herself with a 2 month old baby.  We never once felt uneasy with the staff and always felt like we were simply letting family go in and out as they needed.  I would recommend Pickett to anyone in need of home repair and we will definitely use them again for our next projects!

name: Vandy Lowery
text: Put in wood flooring. Excellent job.  Looking at painting.

name: Lynn Sampson
text: After two decades of wind and rain, our Alabaster home's roof needed a re-boot.  I've driven by Pickett Construction's office nearly every day for the past couple of years, so I figured, "They aren't going anywhere!"  We contacted them, got an estimate, and within a week we had a brand new roof.  It looks great; the price was fair; and our insurance company was pleased to work with Pickett.  They knew Mr. Pickett by reputation!  Oh, I can't forget how thorough the actual roofing crew was when it came to cleaning up. The only thing different after they left was our beautiful new roof. I can't wait till we have the funds to set Picket Construction loose on our siding and deck and bathrooms....well, you get the picture! I trust them to do the job right whatever it is.

name: Kurt DeAngelis
text:
We decided to do a major renovation on our 30 year old split foyer in Alabaster. I had a huge wish list that far exceeded the funds I had available and had to prioritize needs, essentilas and desirables. Josh assisted me in mximizing the budget with a detailed proposal that enabled me to do this. Josh did a great job with my wife letting her see and select the tile, flooring and paint, etc.

Do you want to know if Pickett is versatile or can get the job done fast? Pickett did the following items in 17 days ... 350 feet of new privacy fence and gates, paint entire house exterior, re-roof covered deck, remove turbines and patch roof areas, repair rotted roof decking around chimney stack, re-flashed and re-roofed the area, installed new LED motion detecting security lights, installed new outdoor lighting over front door,replaced all windows with new double hung, double pane vinyl windows, installed new laminate/engineered word floors on the entire main level of the house, laid tile in both foyers, kitchen and den/study, replaced every interior door and all hardware, installed new ceiling fans in each bedroom and main foyer, removed wrought iron raining in foyer and replaced with wood and balusters, primed and painted all interior trim, scraped popcorn/acoustic ceiling from kitchen, repaired drywall issues in bedrooms and kitchen, textured and painted kitchen walls.

Any "extra" I asked about was repsonded with a written proposal so that there could be no confusion or disaggrement.

To get these things done in the time frame of 17 days ... including holidays ... shows excellent planning and execution. I was kept informed as to what was scheduled for the day, who would be there and what to expect. They arranged for the construction dumpster delivery and pick up. Pickett did a nice job on the site clean up as well.

Punch list items were few and far between and resolved promptly.

The only thing that would be close to a concern or a negative was the sub-contracting tile guy who was going through a diviorce while he did the job. He did not do a bad job but his distraction resulted in a couple of small punch list things that Josh had Tripp take care of. I was assured that they would not be using this tile guy in the future.

Would I recommend Pickett Construction to you? Absolutely. Want to see pics of the renovation? I have them. Will I use them again in the future? Absolutely. As a matter of fact, my daughter used them on a foreclosure she purchased in Calera. She got prompt thorough quality work done as well.

name: Tim Calhoun
text:
Pricing:
We contracted with Pickett to complete some work on our house to prepare it for sale. We were looking for some typical wood rot to be replaced and exterior paint. We also requested an interior paint quote. I think the quote was a bit high for the exterior work, but not so bad that I didn't go with their services. The quote for the interior painting was outrageous, so we opted for another painter. The other painter's quote was nearly $3000 less than the quote from Pickett. We were also having some plywood put in the ceiling of the carport, because the builder used interior drywall in our neighborhood. Pickett gave us a "complimentary upgrade" to beadboard instead of plain plywood. This really added a nice touch to the carport ceiling, and was an appreciated upgrade. They only requested 1/2-down to start the work, which we felt was certainly reasonable. They also honored their coupon they regularly have (often in the Alabaster Newsletter, or ValPack). We printed ours from the ValPack website.

Workmanship:
The quality of the exterior work was pretty good. There were a few spots where the painting got a bit "sloppy," but was overall good work. The beadboard in the carport made a great upgrade to our carport, and added a touch of "class" to an otherwise mundane area of the house. Unfortunately, due to our unusually cold winter, the holidays, and several bouts with rain, our work was regularly delayed. It took a bit longer than expected to complete, but didn't delay our schedule of listing the house. The little interaction I had with the crew was polite and courteous, though at times the project manager came across as mildly arrogant. Communicating with the PM via email was the best medium, although he sometimes took a bit longer than expected to return messages.

Post Work Follow-up:
Again, the delays in returning messages made for a challenge in clearing our post-work "punch list," but this was also around the holidays, so we conceded a bit.  Had there been more clear communication about workday expectations (e.g. workers will/will not be onsite today) this would have made for better overall feeling about the length of the job.
During our home buyer's inspection, they found more wood rot that was inadvertently overlooked by the crew. While I don't expect the painters to look over every square inch of the house (heck, neither did I!), it ended up being a significant portion of the chimney that had rotted out the edge of our masonite siding. One would expect that at least part of that might have been discovered and either repaired or at least alerted me to the potential change in an estimate so it could be repaired. When we approached our PM about correcting it, he gave us a price quote. After paying over $6000 for the original work, this was certainly unexpected, especially with their "1 year warranty." I spoke with Josh, the owner's son who is also in management with the company. He immediately started working with me to find a reasonable solution. I ended up having to pay a bit more, but we did come to an acceptable compromise on the final cost of the supplemental work. In the end, Josh personally stopped by the house to deliver the revised agreement and took pictures of the missed work. It turned out that the rot was more severe than even he expected. He opted to continue to honor that revised estimate and didn't charge anymore. Josh really worked hard to make a relatively displeasing situation wok out well in the end. Josh was absolutely committed to service and ensuring my end satisfaction. He even reached out after the supplemental work was completed to check in on my satisfaction, and knowing there was a bit of a sour taste, still wanted this Google Review. Josh knows what it takes to listen to customer concerns and immediately find a reasonable solution that works in the best interest of all parties. Had it not been for Josh's actions, my 4-star rating would have been a high 2-star, or low 3-star.

name: R Heffner
text: Caddyshack

name: charlie engel
text: I paid half the money the day I agreed and the remainder was due after installation.  The salesman said it will 6 to 8 week before we can get to it. Three days later they call and got an opening. That was my first red flag. Three guys showed up, the oldest about 20. Second red flag. When it rained I had Niagara falls. A second crew showed up and replaced 95% and added downspouts. They used white screws on brown gutters.  When they spray painted then, they got brown paint all over the soffit.  Bad company!!!!

name: Lashawna Springer
text: 3 different individuals came to my home to give us an inspection and quote. Each time we were told they would bring us a free $25 gift card for our time. When the third individual came, he informed me that they don’t issue the gift cards stating they come from home office! He also wanted me to make a decision today. They quoted me $13,000 which is crazy!!!

name: Charlene Graham
text: I would give a zero if I could. The sales representative that came to our house on 10/10/20 was very rude and pushy to say the least. We made it clear we were getting an estimate ONLY. After he finally gave us the estimate he was insistent that he start the job that day. When we told him we would have to discuss things together he very rudely said “what’s there to discuss?”  That happened several times. He even asked how much did we have to spend on it! He kept loudly saying “I’m ready to start today”. We had trouble getting him to leave as we told him we had things to do. He finally left and sat in his car for a while and then came back to the door. My husband told him he had errands to run. He got back in his car for a while and when my husband was trying to leave he got out of his car and followed him to his pick up insisting on further conversation. My husband had to MAKE him leave! We wouldn’t use this business if it were the only one in existence!! Charlene Graham

name: Dunahwa Wohali
text: Ultimate Gutter Guard completed our window installation in a timely and professional manner.  The new windows added to the appearance of our home.  Gutter Guard management stayed in touch with us during the installation and demonstrated they wanted our experience with them to be a pleasant one.  I highly recommend them.

name: Larry Allen
text: Great gutter system. We had them install vinyl siding, replace wood rot, and cover exposed wood on the entire house. Great team. Professional job! Fair price.

name: Allison Berry
text: We has an over all great experience with them. The salesman was friendly and courteous, as were the men who installed our gutters. The men were quick, efficient  and did a wonderful job and took the care to be quieter around my baby's nursery while she was sleeping. Great customer service and I would use them again!

name: Brian Luna
text: The work was top quality. We are very happy with the new vinyl and gutters. It has made a huge difference in the look of our home and has helped tremendously with some drainage problems we were experiencing. Highly recommended.

name: M Dupree
text: Needs some improvement. The in home quote process is extremely too long. Shouldn’t take 2 hours to get a price. The installers arrived after lunchtime and were finishing up when it was getting dark.  Bottom part of downspouts are just slid on and not attached. Come off during heavy downpours.  Downspout installed almost directly over a sprinkler head. Installers had not installed one of the downspouts until I questioned it.

name: Dave Covington
text: This product is amazing. We have had ours for several months now and we are very happy with them. Our lot has many large Oak trees so cleaning the gutters has always been a big hassle. Now the leaves just go right over the edge with no problems. I recommend you consider these for your home, especially if you don't want to clean gutters again. The crew was very professional and courteous, and they cleaned up and removed all the old gutters.

name: Rodney Murray
text:
Well let’s just first off I was called 14 times over the weekend to confirm the 5 P.M. appointment for today Monday October 14th.
Well the time came and passed without anyone showing up or anyone calling. Needless to say we will be using a different company and hopefully one that can at least keep an appointment.
I can’t imagine if they had been installed and we had a problem. I’m thinking if they would ditch a paying customer they would surely not be eager to fix a problem.

name: Jessie YOUNG
text: The experience with our salesman, the Office Manager (Beth), and our installers was very satisfactory.  Beth addressed an issue I had and the installers took the necessary time to do a great job.

name: The Davis Kids
text: Do not use!! It has been a horrible experience. We had gutters installed in February it is now September and gutters are still not working properly. Called multiple times with problems and was rescheduled 4 different times. I am paying 300 dollars a month with nothing to show for it. They finally came back out 2 weeks ago and still not working properly. This has been a totally horrible experience and I hope no one else makes this mistake.

name: Theresa Copeland
text: After purchasing my home in Jan 2017 one of the first updates was to replace/add new gutters all around. I did some research and was pleased to have selected HSV Gutter Guard. The entire experience was very positive from meeting the sale rep, to reviewing changes with the office manager, then having questions and concerns addressed by the installation team. The follow up calls I received from staff in GA were excellent as I had a small issue come up during an extended period of rain we had; the problem was fixed promptly and to my complete satisfaction. I have been very pleased working with this company and feel this was a good investment for my home.

name: Elizabeth Jackson
text: If I could give 0 Stars I would. They showed up late in an unmarked vehicle. They broke moulding around my windows and caulked it to fix. They left screws in my driveway.  Broke pictures on my walls. Spilled water on my I pad. Stood on my daughter's bed with dirty shoes. Did not encase the windows on the outside as agreed upon. We have gaps around the outside of the windows. If it rains it will rain in our walls.  I have original 1960s flashing still on my new windows. They caulked 2 inch gaps around the windows instead of getting correctly fitting windows. Then they took the final payment without authorization. We had contacted them multiple times to let them know that we were not satisfied and needed some things fixed that they broke., instead of contacting us they illegally charged my credit card, without signature. Now they are completely avoiding us and I'm having to take up credit card fraud because the last payment was not authorized. Nothing has been made right and no one will call us back. This company is completely unprofessional and I would not recommend to my enemy.

name: Sherrill Altice
text: Gutter Guard is a First Class Company! From the first phone call to schedule the appointment, to the installation process of the custom Bow window and 3 additional vinyl windows, Gutter Guard's Staff is to be commended for their friendliness and professionalism. Sales Representative, Chris and Factory Representative, Adam, were both EXCELLENT to work with. They ran a few quotes for our windows with various options for us to be able to compare and reach our decision. Thank you so much for making the shopping experience a pleasure!! Their installer, Jeff and his team, were AMAZING. They arrived in a timely manner and were extremely polite and friendly. Thank you for GREAT team work!! We are extremely satisfied. With Many Thanks, Dennis & Sherrill Altice

name: Debbie Brewer
text: My experience with Ultimate Gutter Guard was positive, in that installation was professional and was completed on time.  Since I have had the gutters installed, there have been no problems with drainage.  I have lots of trees on my property and these gutters have saved me from having them cleaned again and again.

name: V Bevill
text: Terrible experience!  My husband had heard the Gutter Guard gutters were excellent, and we also wanted vinyl/aluminum covering for the soffits and door frames. After a high pressure sales pitch, he agreed to the premium price, convincing himself that "you get what you pay for". Unfortunately, this was "too good to be true". Ultimate Gutter Guard did not deliver the trained, professional, and efficient service they promised. The job was scheduled for 3-4 days and it took 10 days to complete, with the production manager finishing the gutter work himself. Workers arrived late or not at all and our yard was a disaster. There was minor damage to the grass and landscaping and the final cleanup was not as thorough as we had been promised.  We had to supervise the work, call the company with numerous concerns and point out installation discrepancies in an attempt to get what we were sold. We were repeatedly given false/conflicting statements by the salesman, general manger, production manager and workman. At our insistence, they agreed to give us a small discount to avoid a complaint with the BBB. We won't be filing a formal complaint, but we would never recommend Ultimate Gutter Guard of Huntsville

name: Liz Moulder
text: We had new gutters installed earlier this year...after several months and lots of leaves, we're very happy with the effectiveness of our new system.  We also really appreciated the professional (and quick!) installation process.  Highly recommend!

name: Trent GILBERT
text: My recent installation of the Gutter Guard System was outstanding.  The work was done on time by a very professional crew.  The product has exceeded expectations and I highly recommend the product to any home owner that wants to protect their investment.

name: Matthew Gann
text:
Terrible experience.  We had sales team come in, deliver their promises of quality.  The installation team took months to finally get around to our house.  The product itself seemed okay, but the installation team took 2 weeks to do a job scheduled for a few days.  They mentioned looking in Garage windows and in an outside storage area.  The installation was sloppy, and when I complained about some of the issues they started to push back, saying they'd spent so long on the job that they needed to get it signed off to get paid.  A few months later a piece was falling off, and I called.  They sent someone out to "fix it", but I think they just reattached it to the fascia board that should have been replaced on the initial installation.  Now that section is falling again, and I'm having to go through the hassle of getting them to repair the work I paid a premium price for.  I will never use their services again.

EDIT:  After multiple issues that they have come out and "fixed" now they won't return calls, and our soffit has starting falling off of the front of our house now.  The service department will not answer their phones and never return calls.

name: Mike Johnston
text: We ended up not going with Gutter Guard but it’s not because of the product.  I really hate a long sales pitch and a pressure to sign.  “The moment I leave the price goes up and you lose all the discounts I just promised you.”  I personally don’t care about the founder and how great everyone else says they are.  I can do my own research if I want to know that kind of stuff.  For the price  they sell their product for (2/3 more than anyone else) you shouldn’t need the pitch.  All the best work I’ve ever had done has come word of mouth.  I avoided this company on that alone.  Champion Is exactly the same way too.

name: Alese West
text: Gutter guard  gave our home a new look, and the service was great even down to the financing. we give them a two thumb up. Love it

name: Carla Holder
text: A representative at Sam's Club set up an appointment for the next day.  The gentleman who showed up didn't know insulation so he said that someone else in installation would need to be brought in.  Four days later I was called and they set up an appointment for an insulation installation specialist.  He was a no-show.  I called in and was told that my husband needed to be there.  Their rep at Sam's Club had never mentioned that so I asked to speak to a manager.  The manager rescheduled for the next day.  They were a no-show the second day.  I called in and explained that I was the decision maker, so they scheduled to come out the next day.  They were a no-show the third day. name: Mike Cee
text:
Window World of Dothan just finished up doing the rest of our windows.  We had some done earlier this year, and the rest of the windows done today.  Both times I was extremely pleased with the entire process, from sales to installation.  Great professionalism, excellent service, and all around wonderful people to work with.

We did have one issue with a pane that the seal failed on.  That's a real test of the warranty, and I was very pleased with how easy it was to get it corrected.  Small issues happen, what really counts is how they're handled.  Window World of Dothan made the process of get it replaced so easy-one quick email and it was done.

Kudos to the entire team at Window World of Dothan.  You folks are great, and I have no problem recommending you.

resp.text: Thanks Mike. Appreciate your business and taking the time to do this review. Apologies for any inconvenience, but happy that you are satisfied with the final product.

name: C. Gatlin
text:
If I could give Window World of Dothan, AL a -100, I would.  I would NEVER refer them to anyone nor EVER use them again.  They are the absolute worst in customer service.  The salesperson is the face of the company and that’s about as good as it gets.   It is difficult to contact them by phone and when you do no one is ever around who has any answers.  The receptionist or answering service must always get back to you, and usually never the same day.  I don’t know the criteria for Window World being ranked as the #1 replacement company in America, but it can’t be based on any contributions from Window World of Dothan, AL, at least not for doors and shutters.

We contracted with Window World of Dothan, AL on 1 Oct 2019 for 10 sets of outdoor shutters and a front door.  The install should have only taken a day. The install began on 16 Nov in the late afternoon and still has not been completed as of today, 9 Jan 2020.  The individual sent to install the shutters and door obviously didn’t care about the job because the quality of the installs were substandard.  We tried to give him space and let him do his job, but that was a mistake because when we looked closer at the tall shutters they were installed with only 4 pegs instead of 6 (industry standard) and did not place the pegs uniformly (symmetrically) into the mortar, some directly into the brick.  When asked if 4 pegs was a Window World standard, he said it didn't matter.  We also asked if he filled the old holes and he stated "some",  which we knew meant "none". His defense was to say there were lots of holes in our house.

The installer completed the haphazard shutter install and departed because it started to drizzle and he didn't want the caulking to get wet. He was supposed to return the next day (Friday) to install the door.  He sent a text on Friday to say he was still on a job in GA and wouldn't arrive until the afternoon. We responded that we didn't like afternoon appointments because he would be rushing the door install the same way he rushed the shutter install and make more mistakes.  He agreed to return the following day in the morning.  Meanwhile, my wife attempted to call Window World, Dothan several times to ask about the standards for shutter installation but no one ever called her back.

As he was installing the door on Saturday, we let him know the door was not square in the frame.  His ongoing response was to tell us that our house was the reason the door wasn't straight. Once the install was complete we continued to let him know we were not satisfied with the way the door looked in the frame.  As he prepared to install the storm door, he realized the frame had to be shimmed and stated he would return on Sunday to finish the job.  When he returned at 9am we told him that the thresh hold needed to be adjusted more because we could see car lights under the door and feel the cold air. He appeared a little agitated. He became more agitated when my wife asked "hypothetically" what would happen if we wanted to discuss the possibility of getting another door. He then said he could fix the door.  My wife asked him if that was the case why he hadn't fixed it in the first place.  He proceeded to tell my wife that she complained about the shutters and every little thing about the door. He then stopped what he was doing and left the storm door uninstalled.  He told her that day was his last day at Window World so he didn't care if we complained.

My wife called Window World the following Monday  and asked to speak to the owner.  Instead of being contacted by the owner, the salesman was sent for damage control.  He stated he would have the shutters reordered and expedited.  Another installer was sent to correct the door install.  He made some additional adjustments that helped but was still not the quality of install we expected.  It is currently 9 Jan 2020 and we have not heard from Window World about the shutters or the fact that we are extremely DISSATISFIED customers.  Their lack of care, concern, and communication speaks volumes about the organization.

resp.text: Mr. Gatlin, we appreciate the time spent sharing this information with us. There are several items mentioned in your comments that we are not clear on from our previous communications with you. We would appreciate the opportunity to discuss in more detail, as well as give you an update on the shutters we reordered for you. Management will reach out to you promptly to discuss. Regards.

name: harlee smith
text:
Keith is AH-MAY-ZING! He is not just a windshield "dentist" - he is a windshield miracle worker!! My husband and I were traveling to Tuscaloosa the day before, and a rock hit the windshield of our Mercedes and instantly created about a quarter-sized "firework" (my word - not the technical one, I'm sure!) On the Saturday of Memorial Day weekend, he let us come to his house and we were ready-to-roll in about 15 minutes ... and with a windshield where I could not even identify where the crack was previously!

On another note, we had had a much smaller one previously repaired a few weeks ago, by a "big name" company. And although they were extremely nice and did a good job, I can still see where that one was located - and as I said, it was a MUCH less destructive crack than the one Keith literally erased from our windshield.

Very nice man - great work - great price - in-and-out in 15 minutes. Cannot ask for more.

name: Jason Horvath
text:
Salesman Kevin was very knowledgeable and convincing that Champion Windows is the best option and we would have no issues so  I cancelled my appointment with a competitor for the next day. Kevin mentioned it would take 6-8 weeks (possibly as little as 3 weeks) but there was absolutely NO communication from Champion the whole 8 weeks. On week #6 half the bill was charged with interest with NO work being completed and no communication on when it would be completed/started. When this was addressed with Charlie (owner) it was ignored and not resolved. There was no mention of us being charged BEFORE work was completed. We called the Champion local office twice with no response. On the 3rd time we called corporate and Damon (installation manager) quickly returned my call.
The installation guys were 40 minutes late from appointment time, again with NO communication. I had to call to find out they needed to stop and get caulk on the way to my house. I would think they would have been prepared with the proper equipment prior to the customer's appointment time.
The installers were polite and professional, however I brought up some quality issues during the installation process that did not get properly taken care of until they said they were leaving causing them to stay longer and redo some of their work. (Gap in the J-molding, they wanted to caulk the gap, not fix it) Corporate called me wanted me to sign a form stating the job was done even though the installers were still here finishing the job.  When I mentioned the issues regarding some other problems (window & screen defects) Damon called me to come out to resolve the issues.
Bottom Line: Customer service and apologies goes a long way. I feel that I had reach out and try to communicate to get the work done that costs thousands of dollars. As a customer, I should not have to work as hard as I did to get the job done properly which is still in progress.

resp.text: Thank you for your feedback, Jason. We use this feedback to make sure our services are nothing less than the best for all our customers. We are sorry to hear that you had a poor experience with us. If you would like to reach out to us in national customer care to speak further, please call us at 513-327-7338. Thank you.

name: James Tynan
text:
5 Stars -They did a great job in 2017 when they installed my sunroom.
0 Stars - In the last few months (April-May 2021) I have been trying to get in touch with someone, anyone, at Champion anywhere from Huntsville Alabama to their offices in Cincinnati. I have spoken to a few people that have given me nothing but a runaround. Several promised they would work out my issue and follow it through to a satisfactory conclusion. Nothing happening so far and based on recent past experience, I'm not holding my breath.
All I am trying to do is get a pet door that fits the wall in may 3 season room. I'm willing to consider buying it out right or having them install it. Can't even get anyone to talk to me about it.

resp.text: James, We want to sincerely apologize for your negative experience with us. We want to make things right. Please call us in our national customer care office directly at (513) 327-7338 at your earliest convenience. We look forward to hearing from you.

name: Cat Taps
text:
We contacted the toll-free number for Champion Windows (please know: this # is not your local Champion dealer but just a service...I hope!) for 6 months!  We just wanted a person to come by and talk to us about a new sunroom. This phone system service (meaning=the "trained" people manning the phones) is highly disorganized! Perhaps it is because of the virus? Leaving messages or even setting up appointments to meet with a representative and that representative never showed is very disheartening. (0 stars for that set-up-an-appt craziness.) Corporate office? You need to get that fixed! Perhaps employ another phone service to answer your toll calls? 🤔

FINALLY...after months of calls...we got our Champion reps at our home.

Matt and Charles came to us in East Limestone from the Huntsville office which is by the airport. Having already had sales presentations by two competitors, we knew what to expect in their presentation. They immediately realized we were most interested in quality and price for our new sunroom.

Matt was thorough in showing us the construction of their unique products. He even had samples to demonstrate the sunroom's best attributes.

We were surprised at the price. Matt was precise and clear on it. One contract, too, one price. Never additional hidden fees. Perhaps we contacted them at the correct time since it is December after all. 😁 Good price for the quality...the sunroom we chose actually can be added to our home square footage.

Charles invited us to come by their showroom. I suggest everyone do this! Seeing several sunrooms already set up truly helps in your decision process versus just seeing magazine quality sunrooms in their catalogs.

Charles even brought us to the back of where products are custom made for every sunroom. These are not kits. We went for the 6in depth walls. Seeing the sun rooms in the office and showroom also convinced us to go ahead with additional products. Charles was not pushy at all. We made these decisions on our own.

Both Matt & Charles also gave us their personal cell phone numbers and we have called them several times. They have always been available -immediately-. We appreciate this courtesy! (Those 5 ⭐'s for them.)

Having read 1-🌟 reviews from a year ago...yikes! We decided to see for ourselves and really tested our sales team. We also detected this Huntsville office was working to improve themselves. So far? We are off to a good start. We are waiting for construction people to come and measurable are sunroom. Hope to bring you up-to-date after this happens.

resp.text: Hello Cat, We really appreciate the time you took to leave such a detailed and thoughtful review! We hope we can continue to provide great service throughout your project!

name: Jeffrey Cole
text:
The other Google reviews they have are accurate! We worked with Matt Jackson to get a quote, but he kept changing pricing every time we asked him to calculate it for us. He lied to tell us about what the windows would look like, and told us the installers were all Champion employees - which they are not. Champion will contract your job out to unprofessional, inexperienced, cheap laborers. Their sub-contractors repeatedly left our house completely open to the elements for hours and even days at a time which led to many issues for which Champion refused to accept responsibility. We spoke to Corey, the install manager, Rob McCauley, the regional manager, and even a national customer service manager - all who insisted the issues we experienced were not Champion's fault. Corey's temper when we involved Rob in communicating our concerns was completely unprofessional. Rob offered to give us a gift card for dinner as a compensation for the trouble we experienced (what a joke!). The national customer service manager threatened me and swore at me when I insisted Champion make the right the issues we experienced.

This company is full of dishonest, unprofessional, and unexperienced people charging high prices for a product of average quality.

UPDATE IN RESPONSE TO CHAMPION'S RESPONSE: If nothing else, please take Champion's sarcastic response to my feedback as a token of their lack of professionalism. You can see from the reviews of others that our experience is not an outlier, but rather the norm for how Champion operates. Of course we noted our windows had just been replaced - WE SPENT OVER $12,000.00 ON THEM.

CHAMPION WILL LIE TO YOU, SEND SUB-PAR CONTRACTORS TO INSTALL THEIR AVERAGE-QUALITY WINDOWS, AND THEN STEAL YOUR MONEY AND DO EVERYTHING THEY CAN TO MAINTAIN THEIR FACADE TO TRAP OTHERS - DO NOT FALL FOR IT!

name: Steve Palmer
text: Excellent Product, Install and Service! This is a good long read. We have a home that has 32 windows. These windows were from the original build back in 1999. Over time these windows failed, broke internal components, were loose, didn't stay up and let so much air in between them; it really hurt our HVAC bills. We decided to look at new windows. We went through the hoops and ringers with various window companies in the area and the big box stores. The price ranges were all over the place and the functions, options, features and price points were the driving factors in this big home reno purchase. We called Champion (CW going forward) and had our salesman Whit come out and give his sales pitch. He did a great pitch and was at our house for 4 plus hours. Going over every detail and question we had. He was not afraid to say "I don't know, but I will find out" and called ahead to ask with us on his speakerphone right in front of him. He never stepped out to his truck to ask; he just did it right in front of us. We wanted an answer and he went and got one. Good bad or indifferent there was no empty promises or sugar coated answers. We were explained all the finance options and the promo they were having during our consultation. We beat him up pretty good with our wants and needs for the windows. After that was done, Cory then came out a few days later and walked me through the measurement process; again answering my rhetorical questions and others I missed with Whit. He took meticulous measurements of ALL my windows and explained what my casements would be and how they would sit in the frame. I walked through the house with and he asked questions to me about each room as he measured and took detailed notes. We discussed the order that was first taken to verify everything was right...the first time. He explained the install and what was done with that process from top to bottom. As well as what to expect with financing options again. Making this as streamlined as possible. He explained our order, what timeline for delivery was and the timeline of the install process once the windows arrived from the factory. Once our windows arrived in Huntsville, we were given a few choices on the install. We picked the date that worked on our schedule and a timeframe that made sense for the install. Once again, were explained the who what when were and how on the install team. The install team was on time the first day with everything ready and planned out so they could hit the ground running. Jimmy Mashburn and Brandon Clark were the install team and they were incredible. I have OCD about fit and finish and so does this install team. Jimmy talked with my wife so she would get the understanding of the install and what she could expect. He didn't make her feel silly for asking and was very professional with each question. We, of course stayed out of the way, but if either side had a question about a window, my wife and or Jimmy/Brandon made sure both parties were on the same page. They took their time and set everything right the first time. We didn't care how long it took and they were very meticulous and detail driven on each window. They were not in any hurry to just set 'em and forget 'em. It was done right the first time. I'm no installer but I'm a homeowner that bought 32 windows so I was wanting to find something wrong or find a shortcut that I saw...NOPE! I couldn't find anything that I felt was incorrect or not done in a make sense manner. Everything was top notch work. All my old windows were removed and stacked out of the way. Drop cloths were placed inside on each opening to make sure the removal was as clean and clutter free. All of the windows were set correctly, openings were cleaned from past dirt and debris. Professional 100%!! I felt that my money was going to the right company for our home. These are big decisions to make when getting new windows and the value of the CW product met our families need. We are truly very happy with our windows and would recommend CW to anyone!! We are very happy we went with Champion!

name: Claire Clune
text:
We were given a 5 week timeline for installation. After taking a half down payment ($3100) we haven’t heard back. After 7 weeks, my husband called a few times before they bothered to answer, saying they have no way of knowing when the windows will be done. It’s been 9.5 weeks now and no one will answer my calls or return them. I certainly understand delays are sometimes out of our control, but it is absolutely unacceptable that they are not staying in communication with us. A simple call with ‘so sorry, still in production!’ would go a long way here! I will absolutely not be recommending this company to anyone else. I welcome window depot to try to reply to this post; might be the only way I can get in communication with them. I will update if we ever hear back or get our windows installed.

UPDATE: Finally did receive a call back (After leaving messages last Wednesday and then again today) and they seemed more than a little peeved I expressed that I was unhappy with their lack of communication. Regardless of COVID as an excuse for slow production, communication of the delay should have been a given.

name: Joseph Carton
text: Ordered windows on 7/30/16, install date was 10/11/16. Windows came in with internal grids that were not even, screens missing or damaged, one window measured wrong, installers damaged tube in master bath, windows in living room came with no grid. As of 1/12/17, still waiting them to finished installation. Very hard to give a good rating based on this service they provided.

name: Dominique Ponder
text:
Wouldn't recommend anyone to use this company. We paid a deposit on our windows on June 1st, we were told it would be 8 to 10 weeks before they were installed. Called after 10 weeks  told the production company had delays. I had to call multiple times to find out this information. Never once did they call to inform me about any delay. So I waited another 4 weeks and called back. Got the same run around. Called back 2 to 3 weeks later and told them that they had a couple of days to figure something out or we would seek legal action. Miraculously a few days later they called with a confirmed ship date. The windows finally shipped and we had an appointment for install the next week. So TOTAL time from paying deposit to install was 19 weeks and 5 days.

After they installed the windows and my wife paid them, I get home from work to see trash in the driveway and the yard. I call Zach the owner and told him about the issue. Luckily they hadn't left town yet and were able to come back and clean up their mess.

name: Jason Hunter
text: I'm extremely glad that I chose Window Depot to replace my windows. The customer service from Bill  the salesman a retiree was an honest straight shooter. He did not try to sale you anything that you did not need. Zach the installer took really good measurements. He also explained in details how the windows would be installed and he answered all questions. Saving the best for last is Josh and Mike. The are the actually installers. Words cannot express about there workmanship. This is the best two man crew I have seen. They showed up on time ready to work. They did not take any lunch breaks except water breaks. They also explained the how's and why's of how they had to install the windows. On top of that Josh also fix my Doors from some previous installers. They are extremely detailed and the work can speak for itself. On a scale of 0-10 I would give them a 10 and recommend them. I will be calling them for future work if they can do it.

name: Kelly
text: We are very pleased with the windows we had installed by Window Depot. We were given lots of information and helpful advice on finding the perfect windows for our project. The installation crew was incredibly courteous and went above and beyond with getting a date set for our windows to go up .If you're rearching companies in the area for your next home project, no need to look further. Go with this company.

name: Pavlos Honderich
text:
I had 4 bids to install 16 total existing windows original to a 3 year old house.

We wanted to install 3 slider windows where we currently had a total of 4 single hung and 3 picture frames (2 sets of 2 and a set of 3 respectively).  The remainder of the single hungs would be replaced by double hungs and the 3 remaining picture frames would be replaced with picture frame windows.

Only Bill from Window Depot would listen to us and provided honest feedback some of which may have actually resulted them taking a few hundred dollars the less from us.  They also gave us an honest price since we went with our own financing.

It was the complete opposite than what we experienced with Champion who insisted on bells and whistles we didn't need or want and cost $2000 more for the same style and quality windows.  Champions sales pitch was also high stress (must sign today shtick to get special demo offer).

Window World had come recommended from a few friends but they insisted we go with double hung in all but the one picture frame over our bay window.  They insisted it would cost too much and wasn't worth it vs their recommendation for 15 double hung and 1 bay window.  Customer always knows best and Window World lost the job from the get go for that mistake.

The quality of the Window Depot installation job is also visibly much better compared to friends who have had Window World windows installed.

Bill in sales and Zach were great to work with.  Josh and his crew did an amazing job installing the windows.

name: Susan Goodson
text: We met this company at a home show in Huntsville.  At that time, we were in the process of selling our home and from the feedback we received, folks were wanting lighter cabinets which is why we spoke to them.   Fast forward a few months.  I rec'd a call from the company following up from our contact.  I scheduled an appt. but told the caller we have since moved but the home we own now was in need of a kitchen re-model.  The appt. came and went and no one showed.  Come to find out, rep went to our old address ( I gave new address during the phone call)  I called them to reschedule.  Rep showed up at our home and that was the end of the beginning.  He did not listen to us.  We did no want re-facing but he continued to measure existing cabinets which we did no intend to keep.  I asked to look at the books he brought in.  He asked rather snarkily, have you checked out our website???  Yes, but since you have books can I look?  At the  end of a very awkward meeting, he said they have a designer that could help with what we want.  We have not heard anything from this company 4 months later.  The end.  Would not recommend this company.

name: Sam Woodson
text: Terrible - Warn Everyone, RUN AWAY - Small hole in the tint the first time, I told them immediately, they said come back the Sunday. Sunday, they didn't show up, they called me back and said to come the Monday. Monday they said they were out of tint, I had to go buy my own so they would fix it. Well, this time they cut it too short and there is a gap at the bottom. They said come back Wednesday when they get tint in again. I just went there, they refused to fix it unless I pay them again. Blamed me for buying the wrong tint. I asked first, Advance Auto, they said yes and could have asked me to exchange in on Monday if there was a problem with it. The problem is HE cut it wrong, there is a gap at the bottom. He said he didn't have time to deal with this. Also, the other window also has scratches and a bubble at the bottom, but that seems really minor at this point.

name: Sarah Betz
text: My husband had my windows tinted at a birthday gift. There was lots of bubbles & debris between the glass and the tint on all the windows that were done. I took the vehicle back to be fixed within the 14 day replacement period. Upon arrival I entered the garage because the front door was locked and a sign on the door said to enter garage if door was locked. The owner was nice until I said I needed repairs done. At this time he started to yell at me and state that I was not allowed in the garage. He also said that there would always be bubbles and imperfections in the tint and that "nothing is perfect!". He refused to do any work to fix their mistake unless I paid more money and made an appointment for another day. He then threatened to call the cops on me when I said he should honor his work and make it right. Needless to say I left very upset and will NEVER do business with them again. Beware if you go to have work done!!

name: Loretta Mitchell
text: I need my truck detailed badly and I have been searching online to review my options. I have to say "Mr. Owner," you clearly say that "Mr. Lamont" is mentally ill and falsely accusing you and your employees of poor customer service...however, if you have taken the time to read the reviews of your previous customers, you would plainly see the unbelievable number of dissatisfied individuals. With that being said "Mr. Owner," it is almost mathematically impossible to that many unhappy customers without there being any validity and truth to what's being said. So, regardless of how well your business may or may not be doing, I strongly recommend that you listen to your consumers and work on how you treat the individuals that CHOOSE to grace you with their business and their money! ijs...

name: Strictly Indy
text: This place messed up my tint on my 2015 nissan. Left windows up for 5 days just to assure it was dry.. The drying was no problem for me as I have other cars to drive. Once I let tint down, very shocked. No the tint didn't slide because it's totally dry. The problem is the cutting is awful. Not Acceptable. I'm sure a 1st grader could cut better than this. I called the guy because this business has tinted other cars for me but when they was in the old building next door, He wasn't the one I did business with In past. No big deal, maybe I have came out  a day the boss is going to do my car instead of a worker. Talked good to get my payment... but now that I call him and ask that he look at my car when I bring down. He started screaming at me. And told me no you can't bring your car down, deal with it, do what you have to do... I was very shocked. Bad customer service and to be honest the way he was screaming. Anyone would be scared to take car down now. He not willing to look at or fix... but since he was running business on a cell phone, I went ahead and sent the photos so he could see his job and skills is awful....

text: Worst place to go. My wife wanted her windows tinted professionally and got shade tree service. There were bubbles underneath the tint. The inside back rear window tint is hanging down  from where he tired to remove the bubbles by using some tool but, he only made it worst. The owner was very unprofessional and degrading. I wouldn't refer no one to the company. 1-Day Tint 1.4 miles West of University will be a much better choice. Especially if you want 100% Satisfaction and Great Customer Service.

name: Cameron Grace
text: I had windows tinted on May 29.  First indication I should have left was when the price in person increased from the phone price. I went ahead anyway.  They ran my vehicle the entire time while working (1 1/2 hrs) even after my request not to do so. Their explanation was the battery would discharge otherwise.  I have had numerous vehicles tinted and have never incurred this problem.  Upon inspection, many ares of small bubbles were noted.  They insisted they were water bubbles and said they would go away. I returned on June 4 to address the bubbles that remained.  The employee still insisted they were air bubbles and to give a few more days.  I returned on June 13 (my next opportunity).  The man in charge asked for my receipt and said that I was past my warranty for replacement and there was nothing he would do.  I would not recommend this shop simply because they do not stand behind their work.  I had returned (June 4) within the warranty time frame (14 days) and they sent me away insisting the problem would go away.  The problem remains.  All they want is your money, not your business.  I wish I would have received the same service the other review received.  Go elsewhere!

name: Henry Seright
text: This was the worst experience I have ever had at any automotive accessory shop. On 3 July I took my GS350 to have the tint removed from my rear glass and have it replaced with ceramic tint that I purchased from tintzoom online for $200.00. When I arrived the owner and I agreed on a price of $190.00 to do all window with the exception of the left front and left rear (I had already installed it) with the tint I supplied. Having done over 50 tint jobs at a reputable local shop while in college (10 years ago) I know the proper way of installing tint, but being a little rusty I decided to take it to a professional to ensure the tint was removed properly (Steamer or Ammonia and Black Bag). After pulling the car into the shop to start the job I noticed the CARWASH DETAILER with a razor blade hacking at the tint in the rear window. I immediately asked him to stop and asked the owner to take over before he ruin the rear glass defroster. I then left with my ride that was waiting (big mistake) and had him take me to the bank to get cash for the job.  When I returned my car was supposedly ready. I looked at my rear package and it was covered with tint scrapings and my defrost lines were no longer black they were gold (as in no longer working from scraping with a razor). I also noticed that my 3rd brake light was torn to pieces, and there were several pieces of tint left on the window with new film laid on top of it. Soon after I spoke with the manager to inform him of my displeasure with the services rendered. The first thing I asked the owner about was my 3rd brake light and his answer was “We had to break it to put the film on.” The second was my defroster his response was” We had to get the tint off.” The third issue with this humbling experience was the patches of old tint eft on the window with new tint installed over it, in which I received no response from the owner. My response to the owner was “I am not paying for this,” so he decided to vacuum some of the tint from the rear package tray and reduce the price to $165.00 since he broke my $250.00 3rd brake light. After I still refused to pay we both called the police (Little did he know I was on the phone with a good friend who is deputy chief of police). So between the times the police arrived he decided to rip the tint off the windows and throw my $200.00 ceramic tint in the trash, despite his wife warning him not to. When the police arrived he lied about ripping the tint off and even said I didn’t bring any tint to him and stated that he supplied the tint. After looking at the car the officer asked why is there just tint on the driver side windows, I stated that is because those were the windows I did myself. To end the story the officers did nothing (OF COURSE) and stated it was a civil matter which is probably true. Long story short I am out $568.49 to replace the rear glass to get my defrosters back (plus installation), $200.00 for the ceramic tint that he decided to rip from the window and throw in the trash, and $250.00 for my 3rd brake light the he tore up. PLEASE do not go to the poor established called Customized Auto Detail & Window Tinting or you will receive a humbling experience like mine.

name: LAMONT WATERS
text: Most unprofessional bussiness that I have ever encountered. First off there was nobody in the front office I waited 20 minutes to get a quote. Then I went into garage to get some help the guy said "boss man will be back later just wait". So I waited about 20 minutes nobody came. I then called the number on front of the building and this Tyrone character answered. This fool said "you should have just walked in the front and asked for help". I told him I did they told me to wait on you. I went back into garage they told me to wait again. Then this idiot Tyrone called me back 3 times! "Get the f@$k out my shop" blah blah. I told him why are you calling me I already told you I don't want your bussiness bye. The owner is an idiot. I wouldn't go there for a window tint if he said he would pay me. Enter at your own risk.

resp.text: Thank God there's two sides  every story Mr.  Lamont  came to our business with no appointment and a terrible attitude we have a bell up front that tells you to page for assistance he called and we answered the phone and told him the assistant would be there to help him in a minute he refused to say what he wanted so how can we help him after talking to him he we found that he was simply playing games and didn't want nothing out of 5000 customers a year it seems you always get a bad one from time to time we try very hard to take care of all of our customers and so far we are doing a good job at it but Mr. Lamont was reached out to by one of the assistants and had a terrible attitude so we asked him to leave before we called the police if there's a truth to be told then that was it by the way there's no one called boss man that works there we later found that this man had mental issues  may God bless you Lamont

text: Worst detail job ever!!! The owner was 45 mins late arriving, asked for $50 more than the quoted price, was extremely rude, and the work was pitiful! A third of the headliner wasn't touched, there was something that looked like blood on the console, the cup holders were still sticky from spills, there was tape left on the exterior back glass, the carpet and seats were very wet and now smell of mildew(and are still stained), and they somehow used 1/4 tank of gas. The service was horrible and we were charged $200 for this. I urge you to use any other detailer, not these guys. They should not be in business! !!

name: Debbie Daniel
text: I have tried for two years to have a glass company come and look at a custom made double paned window that needed the inside glass replaced.  No luck.  Then I thought I will try one more time.  I call Huntsville Glass, Mr. James Davis came out and looked at the window, they called and gave me the estimate, and once the glass was in Mr. Davis came back and installed the glass.  He was exceptionally professional, let me know when he would be out and in no time it was done.  I really appreciate the service.  The window looks great.  I will do business only with Huntsville Glass.  I highly recommend them.

resp.text: Wow Debbie! We hate to hear that you ran into so much trouble before you found us. James is definitely an asset to our company as well as to our customers. Thank you!

name: Debbie Schaffer
text: We are repeat customers - this is our second glass shower door installed by Huntsville Glass, and we are extremely pleased. From our first phone conversation, the installer coming to the house to measure, and the actual installation, Huntsville Glass was professional, courteous, careful, and did excellent work.The first door was installed over 4 years ago and still looks beautiful and works like new today. The second door - a slider door, is only a week old, but we are loving it. If we needed a third shower door, I would call Huntsville Glass! Over the years, I've also had various pieces of picture frame glass and mirror glass cut to size and had excellent service too. Thanks to installers John and Curtis!

resp.text: Thank you for letting us know you have had a great overall experience with us over the years Debbie. We are always glad to hear our technicians and staff are taking great care of our customers. We look forward to continuing to help you with your glass and mirror needs!

name: cathy veque
text: We have had Huntsville Glass replace the double pane glass in several of the windows at our home.  They are very good to work with from the office to the technicians.  They arrived on time and went right to work.  They did the reinstall  in a short time frame and were very professional and courteous.  Today was our 2nd time to use them for this service and they were once again a pleasure to work with.

resp.text: Always a pleasure to hear from repeat customers. We hope to always be your "go to" for any and all of your glass needs.

name: Ryan Green
text: Punctual, quick, and affordable. Responded to my broken window situation in very little time. Pleased with my experience would use HGC again for my glass needs. James JR did a great job and was very communicative during the entire process. Thank you!

resp.text: Ryan, we are so glad to hear about your pleasurable experience. It's always great to hear when our employees put extra effort into customer service and communication. We look forward to serving you again!

name: Sheryl Payne
text: Recently a rock got flung toward my storm door while the front yard was being mowed.  I had one of those decorative films on the window pane that actually kept the glass from shattering everywhere. I called HSV Glass and working with the support team was very easy. I accepted the estimate and 3 weeks later my new window pane is installed. Mr. John May and Mr. James Davis, Sr. came out this morning and did a great job of removing the old shattered pane and installing the new one.  I was told to let the window 'set' for about 24 hours to really let the seal do it's job and after that I can put a new film on if I wanted.  I really appreciate the work the guys did and of the great customer support /service from Ms. Sherri.

resp.text: Sheryl, we appreciate you taking the time to share your experience. We understand that dealing with the unexpected can be difficult. So glad to hear that we provided such service.

name: Jon Hutchinson
text: Very pleased with Huntsville Glass. Very friendly, courteous and professional staff. James and James Jr. did a fantastic install of a new pane to replace one that was broken by a flying rock.

resp.text: Thank you Jon!!

name: Derrick Graham
text:
I wanted to share my testimony. It’s long but it just shows how much this company cares.

I took my broken window glass to Huntsville Glass for repair. They gave me a temporary one because it would take around five weeks for permanent fixture to  return for pickup.  During this time, I took my bent screen frame to them, or so I thought.  I was told they were unable to do the work and referred me to another company in Huntsville.  Due to my poor memory, I forgot about the conversation. I called to inquiry when would the work be completed. They searched and searched around their facility and couldn’t find it.  To make a long story short, they went the extra mile and called other glass and screen repair companies. They found my screen, through their tireless efforts, they coordinated with those companies to get it repaired. Then, they called me and told me where it was and gave me the number. I was so impressed and I felt bad because I thought they had it.  I apologized and to my surprise, they were very kind and patient with me.

I said all of that to say this!!!!! THIS COMPANY CARES ABOUT YOU AND YOUR BUSINESS!!!!!’ Thank you all for being so professional and patient with me.

resp.text: Its great to know that some businesses still care about their customers. It is an honor to be included in that prestigious group.

name: Camaria Caudle
text: Huntsville Glass has worked with us for years! James Davis, Jr. Is amazing! Our residents always have nothing but nice things to say when he come to the property. Service is always professional, and timely.

resp.text: Camaria, Thank you for taking the time to let us know how pleased you are. We especially appreciate you telling us that the customer service you receive is consistently excellent!

name: A.J. Battle
text: Team worked quickly, and efficiently. Davis Sr, and Davis Jr. Very prompt, and professional

resp.text: Fantastic!! Glad to hear!

name: Phillip Tucker
text: Excellent service provided by Huntsville Glass. Our repair was relatively simple, but technicians John May and James Davis, Sr. were courteous, professional, and quick. The replacement of our broken window glass was done as scheduled and to our satisfaction. I would definitely recommend Huntsville Glass for home or business glass repair/replace work!

resp.text: We appreciate your recommendation. It was pleasure serving you. We look forward to serving you again.

name: Nick Coleman
text: These guys were great! Excellent service and great install by John May and James Davis Sr. My son broke our window over Thanksgiving and they came out quoted, ordered and installed soon as possible. Highly recommend!  Thank you

resp.text: You're Welcome! It's never fun dealing with broken windows during the holidays. I am so glad we were able to be there for you!

name: Robert Wolff
text: From start to finish it was a  great experience.  First I got a quote on the phone.  Then I placed the order.  Within a couple of days of placing the order, my glass was manufactured and John called to schedule the delivery.  John and James were courteous, considerate, and friendly.  My glass top for my desk is fantastic.  Highly recommend the Huntsville Glass Company Team!  Thank you John and James.
